title: Homograph attack.

profile.name: Twitter
profile.about: Twitter helps you create and share ideas and information instantly, without barriers.

vulnerability_information:
In the report  31193      cmiller said    "Twitter does warn if the user tries to visit a malicious URL while passing through our t.co URL shortening service. Thanks!"


URL redirection warning not given for punny code URL.


ATTACK:
 I mainly envision using this as an attack against admins of programs that use twitter. for example, if a bad guy can put up a spoof site behind one of these IDN links that one of the admins carelessly enters their credentials into, then the bad guy can go do bad stuff against the target site...
vulnerability_information_html:
In the report 31193 cmiller said "Twitter does warn if the user tries to visit a malicious URL while passing through our t.co URL shortening service. Thanks!"

URL redirection warning not given for punny code URL.

ATTACK:
I mainly envision using this as an attack against admins of programs that use twitter. for example, if a bad guy can put up a spoof site behind one of these IDN links that one of the admins carelessly enters their credentials into, then the bad guy can go do bad stuff against the target site...

activities.message:
Hello and thanks for your report. You are correct that this can be confusing for users, and can potentially lead them somewhere they don't want to go. However, we have other mitigations in place for this. Specifically, our URL shortening service, t.co, will warn users if they are headed to a site that is *known* to be malicious.

Additionally, fixing this problem can lead to other problems. Please see here for examples of some URLs whose unicode representations are not misleading, but whose punycode representations could be misleading.

We greatly appreciate this report, but we don't plan to fix this particular issue.

Thanks for thinking of Twitter security.

However, we have other mitigations in place for this. Specifically, our URL shortening service, t.co, will warn users if they are headed to a site that is known to be malicious.

Additionally, fixing this problem can lead to other problems. Please see here for examples of some URLs whose unicode representations are not misleading, but whose punycode representations could be misleading.

We greatly appreciate this report, but we don't plan to fix this particular issue.

Thanks for thinking of Twitter security.

activities.message:
t.co is not not giving warning,thats why i send i report.It is a malicious URL and it is redirected.

U told fixing this problem can lead to other problem...So, it is a problem..

U told  "Please see here for examples of some URLs whose unicode representations are not misleading"..Where i see?? please send me the link


FIX:
punny code URL is like-->www.xn--fa-bio--.com

If URL leads to xn--fa-bio--.com(punnycode version)
{
set(autoblock)
else
set(warning)
}

If you approve this means, i will send you a quick fix...

Thanks for the compliments....
